item.title: Dads leaving sex education to mums, report finds, with concerns young boys are missing out
item.description: New report finds mothers do more of the sex education at home, raising concerns that young boys are missing out on key information from their dads.

item.title: Family violence survivors waiting years for social housing as demand surges in Victoria
item.description: As family violence survivor and mother-of-two, Maya was assessed as a high priority for social housing. Eight years later, she's finally moved into a suitable home in outer-suburban Melbourne, with vulnerable Victorians left waiting for years as the social housing waitlist soars.

item.title: Sam Kerr scores 100th goal for Chelsea in long-awaited WSL return from knee injury
item.description: Matildas star Sam Kerr scores her 100th goal for Chelsea just minutes after returning to the pitch for the Blues for her first game since 2023.

item.title: Documents reveal unauthorised sediment releases at Blackwater Coal Mine
item.description: A report obtained by lobby group Lock The Gate under right-to-information laws reveal a mine in central Queensland was releasing sediment into environmentally sensitive areas for more than a decade.

item.title: Blind, big-wave surfer Matt Formston inspires students' dance performance
item.description: Record-breaking surfer and Paralympic cycling gold medallist Matt Formston's feats are brought to life in a dance performance by students in New South Wales.

item.title: Reece Walsh fined for headbutt, Pat Carrigan banned for high shot in NRL finals win over Canberra
item.description: Superstar Broncos fullback Reece Walsh will be free to play in the NRL preliminary finals after avoiding suspension for a headbutt on Hudson Young in Brisbane's epic win on Sunday.

item.title: Australia beats India in first of three ODIs before Women's Cricket World Cup
item.description: Australia's Cricket World Cup preparations are in full swing as three batters score half-centuries in a big run chase in the first of three ODIs against India.

item.title: Outback ringmaster Fred Brophy takes his boxing tent to Birdsville for last time
item.description: Fred Brophy will sell you a ticket, spin you a yarn and dare you into the ring, but at 73, the outback ringmaster is slowing down.

item.title: Nepal's Gen Z demands reform as country begins new political path
item.description: Protesters in Nepal say their Gen Z-led movement was not just about removing one leader, but about reforming the system to ensure accountability and protect Nepal’s future.

item.title: Indian cricketers refuse to shake hands with Pakistani counterparts at Asia Cup
item.description: Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav refuses to shake hands after his side's seven-wicket win over Pakistan at the Asia Cup in the latest controversial episode between the two rivals.

item.title: Sydney Roosters confirm ACL injury for Tarryn Aiken on eve of NRLW finals
item.description: Tarryn Aiken will miss the Sydney Roosters' NRLW finals campaign, with scans confirming a knee injury that will require a knee reconstruction.

item.title: Hit-run driver Jake Danby spared jail time by NT Supreme Court after describing victim as an 'oxygen thief'
item.description: One man died and another was injured after Jake Danby struck them with his car outside a Darwin shopping centre in 2024, with the driver then sending a series of "disgusting" text messages about the victims.

item.title: Jake Danby walking out of court
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: SA to roll out ChatGPT-style AI app in all high schools as tech experts urge caution
item.description: A ChatGPT-style app to be rolled out at all South Australian high schools next term has been welcomed by tech experts, who are also warning its use should be carefully managed.

item.title: 2025 Emmys key moments: From Hacks star Hannah Einbinder's acceptance speech to chants for Stephen Colbert
item.description: From a rallying political cry from Hacks star Hannah Einbinder to standing ovations for Stephen Colbert, here are your Emmys 2025 key moments.

item.title: How is Australia affected by climate change? The National Climate Risk Assessment models the future
item.description: For the first time, the government has modelled the threats from climate change on Australia's future. What's the point of a document like this, and can it help us avoid the worst-case scenarios?

item.title: Cricket Tasmania seeking ways to make proposed Macquarie Point stadium 'compatible' for matches
item.description: After initial concerns that the roof design of the proposed Hobart AFL stadium at Macquarie Point would hinder cricket matches, sporting authorities have thrown their support behind the build, saying "we will find a way".

item.title: Newcastle Knights announce Justin Holbrook as new NRL head coach
item.description: Sydney Roosters assistant coach Justin Holbrook has been named the new head coach of the Newcastle Knights.

item.title: Shadow minister Andrew Hastie says he will be 'without a job' if Liberals don't abandon net zero
item.description: Liberal frontbencher Andrew Hastie indicates he will quit or be dumped from the shadow cabinet if the Coalition does not abandon the target of achieving net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050.

item.title: NRL announces preliminary finals dates, Melbourne Storm on Friday, Brisbane Broncos play Sunday
item.description: The NRL has shaken up its preliminary finals weekend, electing to host one of its grand final qualifiers on a Sunday for the first time in 18 years.

item.title: All the latest financial news
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Final rules for social media ban revealed, with no legally enforceable effectiveness standard
item.description: While substantial fines would apply to social media platforms that make no effort to ban under-16s, they would not need to test the age of every user.

item.title: US and China agree to TikTok 'framework' ownership agreement at trade talks in Spain
item.description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says the framework would see the platform switch to US ownership.

item.title: Australia-PNG defence treaty will require countries to 'act' if either one is attacked
item.description: Australia and Papua New Guinea will be legally obliged to defend each other from a military attack on either territory under a landmark defence treaty, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: DNA at crime scene matches Charlie Kirk murder suspect, FBI says
item.description: Tyler Robinson, 22, was arrested last week over the death of conservative influencer Charlie Kirk.

item.title: Climate Risk Assessment's 'high risk' warning for 1 million Australian homes
item.description: One in 10 homes could be effectively uninsurable by 2050, while lost labour productivity to extreme weather could wipe $211 billion in household wealth, the Climate Risk Assessment warns, with tourism, trade, and property values forecasted to take a dive.

item.title: ANZ commits bank errors in its favour. Is there any other kind?
item.description: ASIC has lived by that aphorism in its decision to strike a settlement deal with ANZ over a raft of wrongdoing.

item.title: Pathological Demand Avoidance, a little-known profile of autism affecting kids and adults
item.description: A surge of professional and personal interest in Pathological Demand Avoidance (PDA), an autism subtype — which in children can affect everything from cleaning teeth to attending school — has led to Australia's first-ever PDA conference, to be held in Perth in November.

item.title: WWII-era bombs are killing and injuring thousands in PNG. Now trainees will learn how to remove them
item.description: Trainees in Papua New Guinea will learn to remove unexploded ordnance, as fading memories of World War II expose more people to the conflict's dangerous legacy.

item.title: Victorian childcare worker denies abusing toddlers, says he is appealing ban
item.description: A Goodstart worker who allegedly abused toddlers at a Ballarat centre speaks out for the first time and says he is appealing after being banned from working with children.

item.title: Western Sydney is set to dramatically heat up, this is how communities are preparing
item.description: A "shocking" warning that heatwave deaths could skyrocket brings the issue of urban heat back into sharp focus, particularly in the city's west.

item.title: Will it happen? Crunch time imminent for Tasmania's proposed Macquarie Point stadium
item.description: It's not the be all and end all — but the impending delivery of the Tasmanian Planning Commission's final report is a major moment for the Macquarie Point stadium.

item.title: Residents encouraged to attract native bees amid varroa mite spread
item.description: A pollination ecologist says it is important people play their part in preserving native bees.

item.title: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price and Kerrynne Liddle a 'unity ticket' on Indigenous affairs
item.description: Kerrynne Liddle speaks for the first time since Jacinta Nampijinpa Price was dumped from the frontbench, saying the pair are "on a unity ticket" when it comes to Indigenous affairs.

item.title: Nikki Webster sings with her children for 25th anniversary of Sydney Olympics
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: How to determine if your kid is well enough for child care
item.description: Work demands and a lack of village mean keeping a child at home from care every time they have a sniffle can be a dilemma for many parents. So when it it OK to send them?

item.title: Family comes first for Queensland newsreader Rob Brough after months off air
item.description: The long-time nightly newsreader says it was an "instant choice" to leave work as his daughter faced a battle with cancer.

item.title: Which Centrelink payments will be increasing (slightly) over the weekend?
item.description: Certain Centrelink payments will be increasing with inflation from Saturday. Check to see if you're affected.

item.title: Planning commission rejects bid to turn Redbank Power Station into bioenergy hub
item.description: The Independent Planning Commission of NSW knocks back plans to restart Redbank Power Station in the Hunter Valley, fuelling it with biomass instead of coal tailings.

item.title: Victoria delays Gippsland offshore wind auction, stalling developers
item.description: The Victorian government pushes back its timeline for new offshore wind farms in the state's east in a blow to developers looking to move their projects to the next stage.

item.title: Does washing your fruit and veggies remove chemicals?
item.description: This is what experts have to say about washing fruit and veggies, when looking to reduce the amount of chemical residues we generally consume.

item.title: Concurrent disasters will overwhelm responders, stress ADF, risk report warns
item.description: A dedicated disaster recovery force is needed, or else responders and defence forces could be "overwhelmed" by multiple concurrent natural disasters, the National Climate Risk Assessment warns.

item.title: Breastfeeding Gold Coast mum says she was asked to leave Virgin Australia lounge
item.description: Mother-of-two Elise Turner says she was asked to leave the Virgin Australia business lounge after refusing to go to a bathroom to pump breast milk.

item.title: How Isabelle Kelly shook off getting her 'teeth pushed back' to return for Roosters' NRLW finals charge
item.description: Isabelle Kelly was meant to rest up for a few weeks after suffering an oral fracture that nearly cost her several teeth but the Roosters skipper missed just one match and has now returned to lead the club's premiership charge.

item.title: Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, major United Nations report finds
item.description: Israel has committed and is continuing to commit genocide in Gaza, according to the "most authoritative assessment" to date.

item.title: James O'Connor still hopeful of playing Bledisloe Cup for Wallabies against All Blacks
item.description: James O'Connor has flown to England with his Test future still up in the air, but the Wallabies playmaker has not given up on playing in his first Bledisloe Cup match in five years.

item.title: NRL finals week two team lists: Canterbury Bulldogs pick new halves combination
item.description: Winger Jacob Kiraz has revealed he is happy to keep playing with painkilling injections as a patched-up Canterbury turn to a barely tested halves combination of Lachlan Galvin and Toby Sexton to save their NRL season.

item.title: Fourteen Tasmanian government schools to close for a day due to staff industrial action
item.description: About 800 educational facility attendants across the state — including ground staff, kitchen workers and cleaners — will walk off the job to protest increasing workloads and a funding agreement that has not increased in 28 years.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Man 'choked to death' on ribbons and food in Adelaide nursing home, inquest told
item.description: A nursing home resident known to wander and ingest foreign objects died after choking on ribbons at a facility in Adelaide’s north, an inquest has heard.

item.title: Timor-Leste protesters vow to continue rallying until plan to buy MPs 65 cars is overturned
item.description: The protests nearly doubled in size on Tuesday as people continued to vent their frustrations at a plan to buy MPs 65 new SUVs.

item.title: Australians too dependent on government, says Sussan Ley
item.description: In her first major economic speech, the opposition leader hits out at universal subsidies and says "dependency" has affected Australia's "national character".

item.title: Britain is hoping it has a secret weapon to charm Donald Trump this week: 'all his favourite things'
item.description: The US president has been given something no other world leader has ever received: a second state visit invitation from Buckingham Palace. But assessing the trip's success means looking beneath the pomp and pageantry.

item.title: Threat of stagflation bears down on world's largest economy as Federal Reserve decision looms
item.description: The world's largest central bank is less than 24 hours from announcing one of the most anticipated interest rate decisions of the year.

item.title: The Federal Home Guarantee Scheme is expanding, but just how many will be able to afford to buy in?
item.description: The expansion of the scheme, which allows first home buyers to purchase a property with as little as a 5 per cent deposit, has some warning it will also inflate the market. Here's what you'll need to be earning to get a foot in the door.

item.title: SA's ongoing harmful algal bloom labelled 'cultural emergency' by First Nations groups
item.description: First Nations South Australians say the harmful algal bloom impacting the state's coastline is a cultural emergency, as it continues to devastate beaches.

item.title: Palestinians fear they have no place to flee as Israel's army pushes deeper into Gaza City
item.description: Israeli troops encircle Gaza City as the UN chief slams the offensive as "systematic destruction", with thousands of Palestinians unable or unwilling to flee.

item.title: For the Adelaide Crows, the AFL season was a matter of 'what could have been'
item.description: After an eight-year AFL finals drought, the Adelaide Crows finished this year's home-and-away season as minor premiers — but the club's hopes were dashed by consecutive defeats that left the players and their fans wondering about what might have been.

item.title: Griffith locals push for new health district to meet needs of their community
item.description: Residents and medical professionals in south-western NSW are pushing to establish a new local health district in Griffith, arguing current services are not good enough.

item.title: Cashrewards's abrupt closure leaves shoppers many unanswered questions. Here's what we know
item.description: Two and a half million Australians have signed up for this cashback app, which leaves them wondering what's next.

item.title: New doco Signorinella: Little Miss celebrates the Italian women who shaped modern Australia
item.description: Signorinella: Little Miss, the new documentary from the filmmakers behind Lygon St — Si Parla Italiano, celebrates the tenacity of Italian Australian women in business and beyond.

item.title: NT DPP considering appeal of 'callous' fatal hit-run driver's home detention
item.description: The Northern Territory's Director of Public Prosecutions is considering whether to appeal a decision to allow a young fatal hit-and-run driver who bragged to his friends afterwards to avoid jail time.

item.title: Sam Konstas scores Australia A century in four-day game in India
item.description: Sam Konstas's push for an Ashes spot continues as he clatters a century in an extended session for Australia A in Lucknow.

item.title: WA Police officers subject to restraining orders desk-bound under gun reforms, union says
item.description: New firearms laws meaning WA Police officers can't carry a gun if they're subject to a restraining order are leaving them desk-bound, their union warns.

item.title: BHP alliance to sack 750 workers blaming Queensland government mining royalties
item.description: One of Queensland's biggest coal miners says it does not want to see jobs lost but blamed "the Queensland government's unsustainable coal royalties and market conditions".

item.title: South Australia's feral deer culling program targets eradication amid plague warning
item.description: South Australia has ramped up its feral deer aerial culling program as drought-affected farmers battle the pest on their properties.

item.title: Australia and PNG fail to clinch defence agreement, resorting to communique
item.description: A major defence treaty between Australia and Papua New Guinea has failed to get over the line today, with the countries resorting to signing a communique in lieu of the actual document.

item.title: Sydney Roosters, Brisbane Broncos NRLW favourites, Andrew Abdo banking on finals surprise
item.description: As the NRLW finals kick off with the Roosters and Broncos miles ahead of the competition, chief executive Andrew Abdo is hoping the unpredictability of sudden-death finals will generate some surprises.

item.title: UK protesters arrested for beaming Epstein video on Windsor castle before Donald Trump's visit
item.description: The shots included Donald Trump's mugshot, portraits of Epstein, newspaper headlines, and footage of the two men dancing together.

item.title: Man arrested over alleged domestic violence-related death of Palmerston woman
item.description: A man has been arrested over the alleged domestic violence-related death of his female partner overnight, after she was found unresponsive in the front yard of a Palmerston home.

item.title: Only social media companies know for sure how the teen ban will work
item.description: The social media saga has produced its fair share of intrigue. But the latest big reveal on how the ban will work has left us with just another cliffhanger.

item.title: Conservation foundation maps environmentally friendly areas for fast-tracking renewables
item.description: The Australian Conservation Foundation says it has mapped the east coast of Australia to identify sites suitable for renewable projects that do not impact on biodiversity, helping Australia reach net zero by 2050 with limited damage to nature.

item.title: Why 'everything feels easier' for Chloe Rykers since her breast reduction
item.description: Chloe Rykers says her "big boobs" had, in various ways, made her career harder and left her feeling uncomfortable and in pain.

item.title: SA parliamentary inquiry recommends short-stay accommodation registration scheme and fees
item.description: A South Australian parliamentary inquiry has recommended the introduction of a registration scheme to track short-stay accommodation after finding the sector has played a role in the rental affordability crisis.

item.title: Tasmania's only large-scale private mental health clinic, the Hobart Clinic, to close inpatient site by end of October
item.description: The Hobart Clinic, which employs 100 people and has provided private mental health services for Tasmanians for 40 years, will close its inpatient site by the end of October, citing financial woes.

item.title: Panthers reflect on how Knights loss fuelled run to NRL semifinals
item.description: The Panthers were last on the ladder after round 12, but a "brutal reality check" helped fuel the four-time defending premier's run to this season's finals series.

item.description: The Tasmanian Planning Commission described the Hobart stadium as a "singular, large, bulky monolith" with "optimism bias" in the government's cost-benefit figures. What does this mean for the stadium?

item.title: Toucans and other exotic animals rescued in major Brazilian trafficking bust
item.description: Brazilian authorities say they have disrupted a major animal trafficking ring, rescuing hundreds of exotic animals and making dozens of arrests.

item.title: Albanese has found out nailing down Pacific agreements is harder than expected
item.description: Anthony Albanese was meant to emerge from his recent flurry of Pacific diplomacy holding no fewer than two major agreements — instead he's returning home conspicuously empty-handed.

item.title: In Donald Trump's America, questions not to the president's liking are met with hostility
item.description: As America enters a dark tunnel of dangerous internal divisions and an increasingly violent public discourse, Donald Trump is escalating his attacks on many of this nation's institutions.

item.title: New WA youth detention centre likely three years away, documents show
item.description: A planned youth prison in Perth for high-risk offenders to replace the notorious Unit 18 could still be three years away and cost at least $50 million more than the initial estimate, previously unseen documents reveal.

item.title: Australia refusing to panic over Pat Cummins's injury ahead of Ashes
item.description: Australia coach Andrew McDonald is confident injured captain Pat Cummins will be fit to play a major role in the men's Ashes, even if he does not feature in all five matches of the series.

item.title: Frank Pangallo 'should have checked his sources' for algal bloom claims, Tarzia says
item.description: Opposition Leader Vincent Tarzia says new Liberal Party recruit Frank Pangallo "should have checked his sources" before supplying a parliamentary committee with inaccurate research citations to back up the latter's claims that desalination plants can contribute to algal blooms.

item.title: Alexei Navalny's wife says new tests show former Russian opposition leader was poisoned
item.description: Yulia Navalnaya says that laboratory analysis of smuggled biological samples had found he was killed by poisoning while incarcerated in prison in February 2024.

item.title: European Commission lays out new tariffs and sanctions on Israel over war in Gaza
item.description: The European Union's executive arm has made a series of proposals aimed at forcing an end to the Israel–Hamas conflict.

item.title: Australia's 2035 climate target will strike a middle path. Will it be enough?
item.description: Australia's next major climate commitment will be more ambitious than New Zealand's and Canada's, but less than the United Kingdom's, as the government strikes a middle path in pursuit of an "achievable" 2035 target.

item.title: NT regulator takes new side job with miner amid calls to quit over gas leak 'scandal'
item.description: The chair of the Northern Territory's Environment Protection Authority has become a "strategic adviser" to a miner but denies he has a conflict of interest.

item.description: Making it to the Paris 2024 Olympics was a career highlight for Jean Mitchell — and the brain cancer survivor marked the achievement in a special way.

item.description: One of the world's most recognised pro-democracy activists needs urgent medical care as she serves a 27-year sentence in a "hellhole" prison, her son has claimed.

item.title: Coal miner Anglo American confirms job cuts in Brisbane, Bowen Basin
item.description: Mining giant Anglo American confirms job cuts in Brisbane and the Bowen Basin in the wake of BHP Mitsubishi Alliance axing 750 workers.

item.title: Man claims council bid to remove 'therapy' roosters is contrary to human rights conventions
item.description: A South Australian council has taken a disability pensioner to court to remove his allegedly noisy roosters, but he has argued the council's application should not proceed because it is discriminatory and the birds are his "therapeutic" animals.

item.title: The Sydneysiders saving thousands by leaving the city on 'financial gap year'
item.description: As Sydneysiders struggle with the soaring cost of living, a teacher has found financial freedom thousands of kilometres away, while a digital marketer swaps the city for the bush to save up $100,000.

item.title: Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium now needs to go to parliament, and we don't yet know if it'll survive
item.description: The fate of Hobart's proposed stadium was never tied to the planning commission's report. Not when the government had long already made up its mind.

item.description: Citizen scientists have collected more than 1.4 million photos and 15,000 hours of audio recordings to help shape the future of conservation management.

item.description: An exhibition at Melbourne's ACMI will pull back the curtain on how iconic games like Hollow Knight Silksong, Team Fortress, Neopets and Sim City were made.

item.title: WA government releases progress report one year into domestic violence reform plan
item.description: As the state government looks back on the first year of its five-year domestic violence reform plan, experts in the field reveal what the government is doing right and where improvement is needed.

item.title: Australia loses second ODI to India by record runs margin ahead of Women's Cricket World Cup
item.description: A 102-run thumping, the biggest loss by runs for Australia's women's team, sets up a thrilling ODI series decider in India ahead of the Cricket World Cup.

item.title: Donald Trump's royal banquet dinner in pictures during historic state visit
item.description: Surrounded by high-level politicians, a media mogul, tech giants and athletes, the grandeur-loving US president was treated to a glowing spectacle at Windsor Castle.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel Live pulled from air by US broadcaster ABC over 'insensitive' Charlie Kirk comments
item.description: The late-night talk show's host suggested during a monologue earlier this week that Charlie Kirk's alleged killer may have been a pro-Trump Republican.

item.title: Man sets out to combat 'isolating experience' of spinal cord injury
item.description: David Ham says the reality of his spinal cord injury hit him when he returned home from hospital and had no-one to talk to with a similar experience.

item.title: How the Collingwood Magpies are righting the ship this AFLW season
item.description: A year after finishing dead last in the AFLW, the Magpies have started making moves up the ladder thanks to a new approach at both ends of the field.

item.title: Australia vows to cut emissions 62 to 70 per cent by 2035
item.description: Australia will vow to cut its emissions by 62 to 70 per cent by 2035, lifting its sights further as the world strives to reach net zero emissions by 2050.

item.title: PNG's much-wanted NRL team has had setbacks. Experts say history is on its side
item.description: Observers say Papua New Guinea's decades-long history of rugby league success and passion is on its side as it prepares for the next sporting leap into the NRL.

item.title: Kyam Maher to be deputy premier after Susan Close, Stephen Mullighan to quit politics
item.description: South Australia's Attorney-General Kyam Maher will replace Susan Close as deputy premier after the latter and Treasurer Stephen Mullighan announced they will quit politics.

item.title: Magpies overlook Bobby Hill for AFL preliminary final against Lions
item.description: Coach Craig McRae reveals he has spoken with Bobby Hill about his chances of playing in the AFL finals, as the Magpies ramp up preparations for Saturday's preliminary final against Lions.

item.title: Mal Lanyon addresses NYE controversy as race for top NSW Police job continues
item.description: Mal Lanyon — who is vying to become the next police commissioner — conceded he should have thought "more carefully" about taking his wife and two friends onboard a police boat on Sydney Harbour on New Year's Eve in 2023.

item.title: The AFL is in danger of becoming a 'two-tier competition' as multiple club captains search for the exit door
item.description: Three captains from the AFL's four worst-performing clubs are searching for the exit door. It is the symptom of a player movement era that has left the gap between the AFL's strongest and weakest larger than ever.

item.title: What are the best ways to clean windows and fly screens?
item.description: Windows and fly screens are often the first things we see when we walk into a home, but rarely at the top of the spring-cleaning to-do list. Experts share their tips on the easiest and most effective ways to clean them.

item.description: Amid the diamonds, whisky sours and flattery of a royal banquet for Donald Trump's state visit, tiara diplomacy was on full display.

item.title: Authorities urge parents to check Little Ones Nappy Pants for khapra beetle larvae
item.description: Hundreds of cartons of nappy pants remain unaccounted for after one of the biggest threats to Australia's grain industry, khapra beetle larvae, was found in the imported products.

item.title: League steps in as Red Cliffs footy players accused of bullying journalist
item.description: A regional football league is demanding an explanation from one of its clubs over repeated comments about a journalist online.

item.title: Cats coach Chris Scott regrets run-in with AFL staffer after qualifying final
item.description: Geelong coach Chris Scott says long-held frustration with the AFL was behind his regrettable post-qualifying final win outburst at a junior league employee.

item.title: WA government flags tougher fishing rules, with dhufish and snapper at 'severe risk'
item.description: Prized fish species including dhufish, snapper and red emperor are at severe risk of population collapse along WA's coast, prompting the state government to flag even stricter measures to protect stocks.

item.title: Hobart stadium proponent dismisses planning commission key issues as 'matters of opinion'
item.description: The agency behind Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium build says it is undeterred by the three key issues raised by the recent planning commission's final report, arguing it comes down to "priorities".

item.title: Disability employment provider Bedford's financial situation concerns SA, federal government
item.description: The federal disability minister says his concerns about Australia's second-largest disability employment provider, Bedford, have grown.

item.title: Family of Aboriginal man killed in Darwin hit-and-run speak out over driver's sentence
item.description: The family of an Aboriginal man killed in a hit-and-run in Darwin have spoken out about the sentence handed to the man who killed him, and the "racist, dehumanising" messages he sent afterwards.

item.title: Albanese to meet with Trump after returning from Pacific empty-handed
item.description: This week in politics, the prime minister returned home from the Pacific empty-handed and the climate debate continued to unsettle the Coalition.

item.title: Queenslander Sean Bell appointed as a senator representing NSW after parliament vote
item.description: An attempt to stop a Queenslander being parachuted into a NSW seat in the Senate vacated by a One Nation senator has failed.

item.title: WA coal phase-out uncertainty amid Bluewaters power station closure backflip
item.description: Efforts by WA's government to force the premature closure of a privately owned coal plant appear to be unravelling after the market operator backed the power station to keep running towards the end of the decade.

item.title: Henley residents advised to keep windows, doors closed amid algal bloom crisis
item.description: Authorities have told a group of residents living near a metropolitan Adelaide beach to close their doors and windows to prevent symptoms related to South Australia's ongoing algal bloom.

item.title: The Albanese government has learned from the last major climate commitment
item.description: The government is keenly aware that the cost of the transition is a sensitive issue, which is why the prime minister was flanked not just by his climate minister but also his treasurer.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel is the latest to be put on pause. How Trump is influencing the world of late-night TV
item.description: Emmys watchers could assume there's never been a better time in Hollywood to hold its most powerful to account, but Jimmy Kimmel's axing proves otherwise.

item.title: Roosters hand Victor Radley 10-match ban for bringing NRL club into disrepute
item.description: The Sydney Roosters suspend Victor Radley for 10 matches without pay following media revelations he allegedly requested an illegal substance from former teammate Brandon Smith.

item.title: Gout Gout, Torrie Lewis miss finals in brilliant 200m semifinal displays at World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo
item.description: Gout Gout and Torrie Lewis have missed the final of the 200m, both running to a hugely respectable fourth place in their semifinals.

item.title: UK police make arrests for spying as Lithuanian prosecutors target Russia-linked arson network
item.description: British and Lithuanian authorities have detained people on suspicion of carrying out intelligence-related activities on behalf of Russia

item.title: All the latest financial news
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Pope Leo talks Trump, sex abuse scandals, welcoming the LGBTQ+ community and China in his first interview
item.description: Pope Leo says he recognises the influence of the United States on world affairs but makes clear he is not a supporter of US President Donald Trump.

item.title: Two people killed in a shooting at West Bank-Jordan border crossing, ambulance service says
item.description: In a statement, the IDF said a person "arrived in a truck transporting humanitarian aid from Jordan, and opened fire".

item.title: Trump says Jimmy Kimmel off-air for 'bad ratings' as Democrats slam regulator for 'bullying' US ABC
item.description: Prominent leaders in the Democratic Party are accusing the US's communications regulator of "bullying" a network to take the long-running late night show off air.

item.title: AI-generated minister addresses Albanian parliament for first time
item.description: The world's first AI government minister was appointed last week by Albania's prime minister to oversee decisions on public tenders and to ease voter concerns about corruption.

item.title: Clashes and disruption in France amid nationwide protests over Emmanuel Macron's austerity policies
item.description: The CGT trade union claims more than a million people took part in demonstrations, while police say more than 90 people have been detained.

item.title: What Donald Trump and Keir Starmer had to say after the US president's historic second UK state visit
item.description: The US and UK leaders held a wideranging press conference after nearly two days of carefully crafted pomp and ceremony. Here's what they had to say.

item.title: UK prime minister urges Trump to pressure Putin amid escalating 'recklessness'
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer says recent incidents, including Russian drones' incursion in Poland, show the Russian president is not "someone who wants peace".

item.title: Independent advice spells out mammoth task ahead for government to reach 2035 target
item.description: Getting to even the bottom end of the government's 62 to 70 per cent emissions reduction target by 2035 will require drastic increases to solar and wind power capacity, electric vehicle take-up and an extension of the safeguard mechanism, according to the Climate Change Authority.

item.title: After deadly floods in Bali, its people want answers. Many are blaming overtourism
item.description: Unexpected and deadly flooding rocked Bali last week at a scale many had never experienced before. In the wake of this disaster, the search for answers has begun.

item.title: The climate conversation is stuck in a loop, but out in the world things are changing
item.description: We don't have to wait for moonshot technologies to reach our climate targets. Most of the solutions to the climate crisis are already around us.

item.title: Ukraine could face waves of 2,000 drones as Russia ramps up mass production
item.description: Ukraine is struggling to defend against growing drone attacks, and with Russia's mass production factories in full-swing there are fears thousands will soon be launched in a single night.

item.title: First Guardian, Shield superannuation disasters expose deep flaws in Australia's $4.3 trillion retirement system
item.description: The failed First Guardian and Shield schemes have cost about 12,000 Australians more than $1 billion in retirement savings and exposed deep flaws in how Australia's $4.3 trillion superannuation sector is regulated.

item.title: Therapists, patients raise concerns over The Hobart Clinic closure with fears it could be 'dangerous' for some
item.description: For more than four decades, The Hobart Clinic has provided private mental health services to clients. Since the announcement of its October closure, clinic staff, therapists and patients have warned of the negative impact on those reliant on the service.

item.title: Gout Gout's understanding of patience shows World Athletics Championships performance in 200m semifinal won't be one off
item.description: Gout Gout's promise and progress are on full display at the 2025 World Athletics Championships. But by showing patience, he could get even better.

item.title: New Huon Aquaculture head Charles von der Heyde says salmon review followed spread of 'gossip'
item.description: Huon Aquaculture's new chief executive officer has described the upcoming review of Tasmania's salmon industry as "unnecessary", saying that a pause on expansion would not stop the company's plans.

item.title: Home owners warned to consider 'liveability' of properties amid climate change impact warning
item.description: Property experts say a "dizzying" report forecasting the impacts of worsening climate conditions on Australian properties has sounded a clear warning for the sector.

item.title: Parents call for football club culture change after death of 21-year-old son
item.description: Steven Callanan had the world at his feet and loved footy like it was a religion. The talented player could bring together communities while he played, but after a night of partying he took his own life.

item.title: Drug checking services handed bitter pill as Queensland government rams through law changes
item.description: The Queensland government has been unrepentant in its tough stance on drugs, with Health Minister Tim Nicholls telling state parliament this week it doesn't "support drug dealers", writes Janelle Miles.

item.title: Earthquake off Russia's east coast causes Pacific tsunami warnings
item.description: A quake that struck at a depth of 10 kilometres off Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula sparks warnings of potential waves three metres above a standard tide level in parts of the Pacific.

item.title: Man fined for dumping 'volatile' chemicals into gutter on suburban Adelaide street
item.description: An Adelaide man who emptied drums containing hazardous chemicals into a suburban gutter — causing nearby residents to experience headaches and nausea — has been fined thousands of dollars.

item.title: Trump says Putin has let him down as he struggles to end Ukraine war
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Trump says he disagrees with UK on recognising a Palestinian state
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Surprise La Niña hints at another wet and stormy Australian summer
item.description: Australia's key drivers of weather variability are stacking up to produce another wet, severe-weather season, with an increased risk of flooding, thunderstorms and cyclones.

item.title: Riverina family grapples with daughter's devastating childhood dementia diagnosis
item.description: Rachel Anderson says she knew something was not right when her daughter Hannah began struggling to remember things she had just done.

item.title: Market live updates: ASX rises, Aus Post to resume US parcel deliveries sooner
item.description: The Australian share market gains, after Wall Street's S&P 500 hit a record high. Australia Post has announced it plans to resume postal sending to the United States on Monday, 22 September, 2025. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Mount Isa waits for '11th-hour' decision on financial support for copper smelter
item.description: Copper production is on the chopping block in outback Queensland, with mining giant Glencore about to decide on its future. What is the cost of losing a legacy industry?

item.title: Kitchen floor at Palmerston Regional Hospital ripped up, replaced following food safety failure
item.description: Large sections of flooring at the Northern Territory's newest, multi-million-dollar hospital are having to be ripped up and replaced after the facility failed food safety checks.

item.title: Miranda Tapsell and Gwilym Lee show it 'takes a village' to raise a child in Top End Bub
item.description: Miranda Tapsell and Gwilym Lee return to their characters from the hit movie, Top End Wedding, to take on parenthood in the TV series, Top End Bub.

item.title: Federal politics live: Albanese seizes on Ley's climate slip up
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has seized on remarks made by Opposition Leader Sussan Ley about Australia's climate targets. Follow live.

item.title: AFL finals fever takes hold as fans line up to buy tickets offline
item.description: AFL fans fed up with the online ticketing system have opted to line up in person days in advance to secure their finals tickets.

item.title: Gout Gout misses out on 200m final at World Athletics Championships
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Man charged with performing Nazi salute at Brisbane anti-immigration rally
item.description: ABC News made police enquiries after being sent a photo of a man raising his arm in what is alleged to be a Nazi salute at the Brisbane rally on August 31.

item.title: Israel-Gaza war protests in Melbourne contribute to $25m Victoria Police spend, report shows
item.description: The report by Victoria's Parliamentary Budget Office includes the estimated cost of wages and other expenses to police the weekly protests in Melbourne's CBD and other operational activities.

item.title: How Hawthorn can upset Geelong as the Hawks meet the Cats in 2025 AFL preliminary final
item.description: With a plethora of options up forward, there's one issue the Hawks need to pay attention to out of their back half if they want to upset the Cats tonight.

item.title: No live export ships coming for WA sheep amid high prices, looming ban
item.description: Market dynamics are stopping live export ships from coming to WA for the rest of the year, raising the prospect of an official end to the trade years before a legislated ban is enforced.

item.title: Seven people arrested over stabbing deaths of Dau Akueng and Chol Achiek in Cobblebank
item.description: Police arrest seven people ranging from 15 to 19 years old in relation to the deaths of 15-year-old Dau Akueng and 12-year-old Chol Achiek in Melbourne's outer north-west earlier this month.

item.title: Water Corporation admits no water left for major new development in Port Hedland
item.description: The Water Corporation has confirmed Port Hedland's groundwater source is at capacity and cannot accommodate major development.

item.title: Gippsland farmer blocks AusNet maintenance workers from entering property
item.description: A Victorian farmer who has hosted transmission lines on his property for decades says he is sick of maintenance workers damaging his property.

item.title: Australian Submarine Agency lobbies Fremantle locals amid protest over AUKUS defence hub
item.description: A push to earn the public's trust over a defence hub south of Perth by the Australian Submarine Agency draws protesters and sceptical residents in Fremantle.

item.title: Erin Patterson trial doctor Chris Webster stands by 'sociopath' comments despite AHPRA sanction
item.description: The doctor who called triple murderer Erin Patterson a "crazy bitch" and a "sociopath" has been sanctioned by AHPRA, but says he does not regret making the comments about the mushroom murderer.

item.title: Pensioner sells home to move in with family in cost of living crisis
item.description: Annette Bleney worked for 45 years and never expected to find herself living week to week on her pension.

item.title: Oscar Piastri says McLaren has clarified team orders after controversy at F1 Italian Grand Prix
item.description: Formula 1 drivers' championship leader Oscar Piastri says McLaren has "had a lot of discussions" since the controversial ending to the Italian Grand Prix two weekends ago.

item.title: Australian Alanna Smith wins WNBA defensive player of the year with A'ja Wilson
item.description: Alanna Smith splits the WNBA defensive player of the year award with three-time league MVP A'ja Wilson, marking the first major individual award for an Australian since 2010.

item.title: Warm currents bring tens of thousands of giant yellowfin tuna to NSW South Coast
item.description: Fishers are reporting an unprecedented number of yellowfin tuna travelling from the tropics to the NSW South Coast, causing "mayhem" and excitement.

item.title: NT Director of Public Prosecutions files appeal against Jake Danby fatal hit-and-run sentence
item.description: The NT's Director of Public Prosecutions has filed an appeal against the sentence of hit-and-run driver Jake Danby, who killed one Aboriginal man and injured another.

item.title: Liam Paro beats David Papot in welterweight fight despite black eye
item.description: Liam Paro fights through a hugely swollen right eye to hand Frenchman David Papot the first defeat of his career in Brisbane.

item.title: Tom Koutsantonis appointed SA Treasurer after Stephen Mullighan and Susan Close step down
item.description: Mr Koutsantonis takes the role from Stephen Mullighan, who is one of two senior ministers to resign from cabinet this week. The cabinet now has more women than men for the first time in SA's history.

item.title: Gardens of Stone State Conservation Area walks open path to incredible vistas
item.description: New South Wales National Parks and Wildlife staff have spent 18 months transforming eroded vehicle trails into rehabilitated walks, opening previously inaccessible viewpoints.

item.title: QCOAL's Cook Colliery coal mine in central Queensland to close half of operation
item.description: A third Queensland coal miner has confirmed job cuts as it prepares to close one of its underground mine sites, with the company also putting the blame on rising costs and state government royalties.

item.title: Victoria's anti-corruption commission searches Chinese language school over alleged misuse of public funding
item.description: The search at one of the state's biggest Chinese language schools relates to an investigation into alleged misuse of public funding.

item.title: Rabbits cause 'devastating' damage to Junee cemetery in southern NSW
item.description: The Junee Shire Council says it is battling a rabbit problem, which forced a recent closure of the town's main cemetery for a week, including on Father's Day, for a baiting program.

item.title: Wiluna leaders hoping 'bounty' will reduce stray dog numbers in town
item.description: Wiluna, in Western Australia's far northern Goldfields, is looking to revive a cash incentive for community members to surrender domestic dogs for rehoming.

item.title: Asbestos discovery further delays Willyama High School demolition
item.description: Nearly two years after a mould-infested high school was closed indefinitely, high-risk friable asbestos has caused further delays to its demolition.

item.title: RONA. weaves together country, colonialism and club music on new EP It's All Here
item.description: This Kaytetye producer has a fresh take on the space race that draws from First Nations knowledge and culture.

item.title: In pictures: Melania Trump bonds with royals over scouts, miniature books and bug hotels
item.description: As US President Donald Trump left Windsor to meet UK Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer, first lady Melania Trump spent the day with the Princess of Wales and Queen Camilla.

item.title: Canberra man jailed for three years after violently assaulting his partner until she was unconscious
item.description: The 43-year-old man was found guilty of attacking his partner, despite her having withdrawn her complaint against him.

item.title: Bruce Lehrmann likely to face four-day hearing in Tasmania over motor vehicle stealing charge
item.description: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann appears in the Hobart Magistrates Court after pleading not guilty to one count of motor vehicle stealing.

item.title: Russell Vale Mine Shaft 4 to trial Green Gravity renewable energy technology
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Green Gravity secures old coal mine shaft to test gravitational energy storage
item.description: A disused coal mine in Wollongong will be the first test site for a renewable energy company that lowers weights down old mine shafts to spin turbines and create electricity.

item.title: China urges Papua New Guinea not to exclude other countries after it signed 'Pukpuk' communique with Australia
item.description: China has urged Papua New Guinea not to sign any deal that might exclude or restrict third parties from cooperating with the Pacific nation, as Australia scrambles to clinch a landmark defence treaty.

item.title: Matthew Draganoff sentenced for murder of tenant
item.description: A man who was found guilty of the "execution-style murder" of his "unarmed" tenant on the northern outskirts of Adelaide has been jailed for at least 28 years.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: A royal visit, a glitzy award show and a new city plays host to Laneway
item.description: A lot happened this week. Have you been paying attention?

item.title: Pat Cummins hints at Ashes strategy amid recovery from back injury with 'starting aim' of playing in all five Tests
item.description: As the men's Ashes approaches, the Australian captain reveals his hopes for taking part in the five-Test series against England as he steps up his injury recovery.

item.title: Cowboys prepare to make NRLW finals debut against Sharks in Townsville
item.description: As the Cowboys eye the path to premiership glory ahead of their sudden-death semifinal against the Sharks, they are also creating pathways off field for the next generation of NRLW stars.

item.title: Gareth Ward's victim tells sentencing hearing of abuse trauma
item.description: One of the victims of convicted sex offender Gareth Ward has told the former NSW MP's sentencing hearing the abuse left him traumatised and suicidal.

item.title: Ex-Greens candidate Hannah Thomas injured in pro-Palestinian protest awarded $22k over dropped case
item.description: Hannah Thomas, who sustained an eye injury during an arrest at a pro-Palestinian rally, is awarded legal costs to the tune of nearly $22,000 after all of her charges were dropped.
